mods:mods.mods:note: Biography of Henry Dwight Barrows who arrived in Los Angeles, Calif., 1854; taught in Southern Calif. three years; married Juanita Wolfskill, Nov. 14, 1860; served as County School Superintendent; appointed US Marshal by President Lincoln (1861) and served four years; formed a partnership with J.D. Hicks, 1864, selling tin and hardware; manufactured pipe, ca. 1874; lived with his daughter Alice for several years contributing to the Historical Society and continuing his interest in Los Angeles

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Henry Dwight Barrows
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Biography of Henry Dwight Barrows who arrived in Los Angeles, Calif., 1854; taught in Southern Calif. three years; married Juanita Wolfskill, Nov. 14, 1860; served as County School Superintendent; appointed US Marshal by President Lincoln (1861) and served four years; formed a partnership with J.D. Hicks, 1864, selling tin and hardware; manufactured pipe, ca. 1874; lived with his daughter Alice for several years contributing to the Historical Society and continuing his interest in Los Angeles
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Pleasants, J.E., Mrs., d. 1943
Barrows, Henry D
